  {panel}

Steps to replicate:

# Create a page with the label 'foo'
# Insert a page properties macro with the label 'FOO'
# Create another page and insert a page properties report macro with the label 'FOO'

Result:

Nothing will show

Expected Result:

As all labels are converted to lower case on page anyway it should accept any case.

Workaround:

In the page properties *report* macro, refer to the label in lower case.
fields.summary: Page Properties Report Macro label field is case sensitive

fields.description:
Expected: when I edit a blueprint template, I expect to be able to use the variables already defined in the blueprint and have them replaced by retrieved data in documents produced by the template.

Experienced: the variables are replaced by their storage markup escaped and appearing as text in the page.

Repro:
1. Space Tools -> Content Tools -> Templates
2. If Meeting Notes template of Meeting Notes Blueprint is edited, reset to default
3. Edit Meeting Notes template
4. Ctrl-END to get to the bottom of the doc
5. Press <ENTER> three times
6. type in:
   Testing the documentOwner variable: $docu<ENTER>
7. UI completes variable name from the selection list
8. press ENTER again.
9. Click SAVE button.
10. Create a Meeting Notes page from the blueprint template
11. you'll see that the storage markup was escaped in the template and so it appears in the page now instead of showing the name of the doccumentOwner as you see above.

I've included screenshots of the template editor showing the variable appearing like any other and of the document produced by the template, in which you can see the markup instead of the contents of the markup, and the storage format of the page in which you can escaped markup.
fields.summary: Markup for variables I use in edits to Meeting Notes blueprint is escaped, not rendered.

In example, the source code below: {code}

Text on the page:

fields.description:
Unfortunetely the JMeter Performance Test Scripts arent supported anymore since Confluence 5.1

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF51/Performance+Testing+Scripts]

This is a major requirement especially for the enterprise customers.

We need to implement these tests for the newer releases as well.

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 20 June, 2017|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}

Hi everyone,

We have made some great progress on the performance test scripting front.

Alongside Confluence 6.2 we released a new [Performance Testing Framework|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/confluence-6-2-release-notes-894219485.html#Confluence6.2ReleaseNotes-AtlassianPerformanceTestingFramework].  The framework uses pre-defined profiles to mimic real-world user behaviour. By mixing and matching these profiles, you can throw a repeatable workload at your cluster and measure the output.
Presently the framework is fully automated on AWS, however does not allow you to attach your own database or run on your own hardware. Whilst we are resolving this issue as Fixed at this time, if there is functionality which you require, such as [CONFSERVER-52635 - Ability to run the Performance Testing Framework on my own network/hardware|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-52635], then please vote/comment on these tickets or, [create a new issue|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/CreateIssueDetails!init.jspa?pid=10470&issuetype=10000&components=47795&summary=Performance testing Framework - ]

We look forward to your feedback on the new Framework

Adam Barnes,

Confluence PM

{panel}
fields.summary: Performance tests for Confluence not compatible with the latest releases

fields.description:
After we upgraded to confluence 5.4.1 (we run 5.1 previously), 
we run into a problem where some of our pages, where we had attached PDF files to, simply stopped rendered the PDF files, and instead an emtpy pdf is displayed. In 5.1 there were no problem to view the PDF files.

The PDF we are using are simply made from our printer, so it shouldn´t be any special about them.

To reproduce, simply add the attached PDF to a page in confluence with the view file macro.

In the log file the following line is displayed:
2014-01-16 13:34:40,384 WARN [DefaultSlideCacheManager:thread-1] [com.benryan.conversion.MemoryAwarePDFRenderer] drawImage Image of size 1656*2339 px dropped for memory protection
fields.summary: Attached PDF is EMPTY when viewing it in confluence

fields.description:
This issue was created to cover the following items that were NOT ADDRESSED as part of https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-29266:

{quote}
# If the gaussian blur we're applying is always the same (image shadows), we should do one of two things:
## Store and display the shadow as a 9 grid (check the image in https://code.google.com/p/scale9grid/) and use that, either when processing the image on the background, or maybe even when displaying on the client itself, although that will be more difficult to do.
## If shadows are not always rectangles, we can use box blurring instead of gaussian. Its faster to process and uses less memory.
# Also, we can process only the border we need to process the image, instead of the whole image size.
{quote}
fields.summary: Image effect can consume memory and CPU

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32241].
  {panel}

This is simply a request to update to the text regarding the use of the macro "Background Color."
The description currently does not explain how to properly use "hex values" as a color choice.  In my world, hex means 0xFFFFFF.  Apparently you need to use #FFFFFF instead.  A simple modification to the description to include an example hex value would be appreciated.

Please update the description to include the proper hex syntax as shown below.    ( _changes_read_like_this_ ):

Sets the background color for a block of content. Colour names or hex values _(_example:_#A0A0A0_for_grey_)_ can be used. 

LevelOfEffort: Trivial
LevelOfTesting: Trivial
fields.summary: Update description regarding "background color" macro to improve ease of use

fields.description:
h3. Diagnosis
Group names have had their case changed in the source directory. The following will appear in the atlassian-confluence.log:
{code}
2013-09-12 01:44:15,408 WARN [scheduler_Worker-9] [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteChangeOperations] findGroupsToUpdate remote group name [ group1 ] casing differs from local group name [ GROUP1 ]. Group details will be kept updated, but the group name cannot be updated
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
(I am using Crowd for this example but this could also occur when using AD or any other LDAP)
# Set up Crowd 2.7 and Confluence 5.4.1 (these are the versions I used, but this bug has been apparent since at least Confluence 5.3.1 and JIRA 6.1.2)
# Create a Crowd user 
# Create a group in Crowd called 'group1'
# Add the user to the group in Crowd
# Create a group in Crowd called confluence-administrators and add the user to it
# Set up Crowd as a directory in Confluence (or JIRA) and sync it
# Change the name of the group in the Confluence (or JIRA) database to 'GROUP1' and sync again
(This is to simulate the casing being changed in an external directory, eg AD. You cannot change the case directly in Crowd, but if AD is connected to Crowd and Crowd is connected to Confluence, when the casing changes in AD this issue occurs)
# Log in to Confluence as the user. 
# Go to Admin > Users in Confluence (confirm the password when prompted)
# View your group memberships and confirm you are a member of GROUP1
# Go to the Dashboard
# Click in the top banner to drop admin rights 
# Go back to Admin > Users, confirming password again when prompted
# Confirm that you are no longer a member of GROUP1
# Repeat steps 11 - 13 and confirm that you are a member of GROUP1 again
# Repeat again and confirm the membership is gone

NB: This is similar to old issues that used to occur when the casing changed, but they all occurred on intermittent directory syncs. That does not appear to be occurring anymore, and it is now only authenticating into the admin section of both JIRA and Confluence that causes this issue.

h3. Workaround
# Remove and recreate the directory in Confluence. NB: Only do this if you are not using [read only with local groups|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Connecting+to+an+LDAP+Directory#ConnectingtoanLDAPDirectory-PermissionSettings] (that is, so long as all the group memberships are stored in the external directory, not in Confluence), as this will cause you to lose the local group memberships.
# Avoid renaming groups to change casing in external directories. If this must be done, co-ordinate with the person making the change, and proactively remove and recreate the directory in Confluence once the group is renamed.
fields.summary: Changing groupname casing in external user management causes intermittent loss of group membership

fields.description:
While editing an existing link using the Ctrl+K hotkey (Windows), the link gets corrupted. The new text is inserted into the existing text.

*How to reproduce:*
# Create a link
# Click into the link
# Press Ctrl+K to show Edit Link dialog (original existing text correctly appears)
# Change the "Link Text" to a new value
# Close the dialog

*Result:* Original text is corrupted. Three links are actually created.

*Expected result:* New Link Text should appear instead of the original text. Only one link should be created.

*Environment:* Firefox 26, IE 10

h5. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a page
# Attach [this PDF|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/101111/101111_Panasonic_NiMH_HHR70AAAJ.pdf] to the page. Ensure that the PDF is attached to this new page. 
# Insert > Other Macros > PDF > Choose the PDF name > Preview
# Result: The PDF is unable to be previewed. It keeps loading:
!load.jpg!

fields.summary: PDF preview loads forever
Remote API for retrieving all attachment versions for a specific attachment
Ability to filter table contents
Count pages based on page property

fields.description:
While on page layouts, when editing a page that exist's with multiple sections and adding a list on one of those sections than trying to create a new list on the next section, may cause the editor to re-focus on the list of the previous section.

This error is thrown: 

Unable to get property '1' of undefined or null reference
fields.summary: IE11 - PageLayouts2 list focus lost

fields.description: Creating a list than press Enter 2x, it doesn't exit the list on IE11.
fields.summary: IE10 - Pressing enter doesn't exit lists.

fields.description:
When creating a table in IE11, the cursor is placed slightly above where it should be.  See the screenshot. 

Tables seem to be getting the wrong dimensions while empty. 

When clicking away and trying to press 'delete' or 'backspace' the table is not deleted.
fields.summary: Table cursor position and table deletion are broken in IE11

fields.description:
Dear sir or madam. Please consider my submission for the most pedantic bug ever reported.

The sixth word in the *loremipsum* macro should be "consectetur", not "consectetuer", which is a word not found in Cicero ... or Latin.

Thank you very much.

fields.description:
Confluence correctly uses the Display URL when rendering links to JIRA issues in Confluence. 

However, it also uses the Display URL when rendering the url for pie chart images, even though those images are not interactive. It seems that since the chart image only provides information from JIRA, it should use the Application URL instead. 

h3.STEPS TO REPRODUCE

* Install Confluence 5.4.1, JIRA 6.1.5
* Create application link, without changing the Display URL
* In Confluence, create a JIRA Status report
* Charts should display as expected
* In Confluence, re-configure the application link by changing the display URL to a fake url (e.g., http://www.fakehost.com/jira)
* Chart images are now broken (see screenshot)

Network information from Google Developer Toolbar shows the GET request and the resulting response (see screenshot).

fields.description:
In Confluence 5.4.x versions, the user is getting comment notifications in a page that he's restricted to view. If you restrict an user to view or edit the page through 'Tools > Restrictions' and then comment in a page, the user will get the notification about it in the Workbox.

h4.Steps to Reproduce: 

# In a page go to 'Tools > Restrictions'
# Allow only the creator/administrator to view the page
!restrictions.png!
# Comment mentioning an user in that page
# Login with the mentioned user
# Check the comment notification
!workbox.png!
# By accessing the page, you don't have permissions to see it
!pagep.png!

This case seems to be related/a regression of [CONFDEV-17188|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFDEV-17188] which was affecting the mention in a page. However, for this one, it's caused only by mentions in comments. Also looks similar as [JRA-29354|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-29354] which is affecting JIRA. 

Note that it only happens with Confluence 5.4.x versions. Other versions doesn't even display the notification for the user. For both the page and the comments.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32180].
  {panel}

We use Excel files as attachments on many Confluence pages. These files are quite often changed/saved, resulting in many versions of each file.

The feature to remove attachment versions is very helpful; but the problem is that you can only do it with space admin permissions.
(https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Deleting+an+Attachment)

There are two problems with this:
- We don't usually assign space admin permissions to the users editing these files. But the users should be able to manage their attachment versions themselves, as the space admin is the IT guy most of the times.
- There's also the permission "Delete Attachments" - why doesn't this permission also cover deleting the versions? It doesn't make sense not being able to remove a certain version while being able to delete the whole attachment (including ALL versions).

So my request is to include the attachment version removal right into the "Delete Attachment" right.

Thanks in advance

fields.description:
Under
User > User Signup Option
You have the option to "Allow people to sign up to create their account"
Once the maximum amount of users according to the license has been reached on the instance, it is not possible to make any changes to this section any more.
Instead, you get the following message presented:
"This Confluence installation is not licensed for additional users"

*Workaround*
Temporarily remove the "Can Use" permissions through the Global permissions in order to lower the used licenses of the instance under the max, change the options, re-add the "Can use" permissions.
fields.summary: Public User Signup option can not be changed when license limit has been reached

fields.description:
Hi,

We're having problems with the confluence-content macro parameter, https://developer.atlassian.com/x/oAAf .  When searching for a page in another space it will return the result in this format: spaceKey:pageName and searching for a page in the same space it will only return the page name. 

So if I create a page called "Test" in a space with the key DS. And then go to an other space and create a page called "DS:Test".

If I use a confluence-content macro field to search for those two pages I will get the same result:
DS:Test
DS:Test 

And there is no way of separating them.  

Further more, it can not handle page titles with special characters like "åäö" properly. 

It would be much better if it would return the pageId instead. 

The attachment macro parameter is not working either.  https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/100824/attachment-parameter-in-confluence-plugin-issue

The attachment type would ideal just deliver a drop down list containing all attachments. 

Currently, we can not use any of these macro parameters which makes the User Experience of the macro browser very poor. Fixing this would really boost the usability of macros and make it much easier for plugin developers to develop user friendly macros. 

Best Regards

Emil Sjödin,  RefinedWiki

fields.description:
*Summary of The Bug*

Confluence ancestor table URL as describe on our knowledge base article [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Rebuilding+the+Ancestor+Table] is inaccessible with the following stack trace:

{code}
java.lang.RuntimeException: javax.servlet.ServletException: org.apache.velocity.exception.ResourceNotFoundException: Unable to find resource '/admin/permissions/help/viewglobalperms.vm'
    at com.atlassian.confluence.util.profiling.ConfluenceSitemeshDecorator$1.doInTransaction(ConfluenceSitemeshDecorator.java:104)
caused by: javax.servlet.ServletException: org.apache.velocity.exception.ResourceNotFoundException: Unable to find resource '/admin/permissions/help/viewglobalperms.vm'
    at com.atlassian.confluence.util.profiling.ConfluenceSitemeshDecorator$StreamingResponseWritingStrategy.renderToResponse(ConfluenceSitemeshDecorator.java:265)
caused by: org.apache.velocity.exception.ResourceNotFoundException: Unable to find resource '/admin/permissions/help/viewglobalperms.vm'
    at com.atlassian.confluence.util.velocity.ConfigurableResourceManager.loadResource(ConfigurableResourceManager.java:401){code}

*Cause of the Bug*

The mentioned URL point to a {{vm}} file located in :

{code}<Conf_Install_Dir>/confluence/admin/permissions/pagepermsadmin.vm{code}

The source code of the above {{vm}} file pointed to a wrong directory since {{help}} directory under {{permissions}} directory is unavailable.

{code}<head>
    <title>$action.getActionName($action.getClass().getName())</title>
    <meta name="help-path" content="/admin/permissions/help/viewglobalperms.vm"/>
</head>{code}

*Workaround*

Edit the mentioned {{vm}} file below:

{code}<Conf_Install_Dir>/confluence/admin/permissions/pagepermsadmin.vm{code}

Remove the offending {{help}} directory in the {{head}} tag, so your {{head}} tag will look like the following:

{code}
<head>
    <title>$action.getActionName($action.getClass().getName())</title>
    <meta name="help-path" content="/admin/permissions/viewglobalperms.vm"/>
</head>
{code}
Saved the modified {{vm}} file and restart your Confluence instance

*Workaround 2*
Put the files Confluence is looking for in the proper location:

* Navigate to <confluence-install>/confluence/admin/permissions in the Confluence install location
* Create and copy the directory and contents of ".../confluence/admin/help" to ".../confluence/admin/permissions/help"
* Copy the contents of ".../confluence/admin/permissions" to ".../confluence/admin/permissions/help"

No restart is necessary. See screenshot for example setup.
fields.summary: Rebuild Ancestor Table is Inaccessible

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32167].
  {panel}

After previewing edits and going back to editing, you can't edit the entire document anymore.

1. Edit a Confluence page that is longer than one screenful.
2. Click the "Preview" button.
3. Click the "Edit" button.
4. Try scrolling to the end of the document, you can't because scrolling no longer works.

After step 4, you have no option but to click the "Save" button, or loose any changes made in step 1. This defeats the purpose of having a preview of edits.

This is with the OnDemand version of Confluence.

h4. Workarounds: 
* Resize the window
* Type a newline into the window
* Open the developer console.

Anything that changes the height of the editor will cause a recalculation of whether a scrollbar is required.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32164].
  {panel}

h4. Problem summary
Under specific conditions, Confluence can run out of memory when a user goes to edit a Confluence page or view his drafts (Username > Drafts), following a sequence of events:
# User A goes edit a page (Version 1)
# Confluence auto-saves a draft based on Version 1, and user does not save the page
# User B edits the same page and saves, promoting the page to Version 2
# User A views his drafts (or edits the page again)
# Confluence tries to merge the three versions (Version 1, Version 1 draft, and Version 2), and results in Confluence hanging

Thread dump shows one or more threads looking like this and using 100% CPU:
{noformat}
"TP-Processor58" daemon prio=10 tid=0x5cd56800 nid=0x7f24 runnable [0x5c4ff000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	at java.util.HashMap$HashIterator.nextEntry(HashMap.java:801)
	at java.util.HashMap$KeyIterator.next(HashMap.java:828)
	at tdm.lib.Measure.calcQDistance(Measure.java:360)
	at tdm.lib.Measure.qDist(Measure.java:306)
	at tdm.lib.Measure.stringDist(Measure.java:187)
	at tdm.lib.Measure.childListDistance(Measure.java:205)
	at tdm.lib.HeuristicMatching.getBestCandidate(HeuristicMatching.java:160)
	at tdm.lib.HeuristicMatching.matchSubtrees(HeuristicMatching.java:120)
	at tdm.lib.HeuristicMatching.matchSubtrees(HeuristicMatching.java:131)
	at tdm.lib.HeuristicMatching.matchSubtrees(HeuristicMatching.java:131)
	at tdm.lib.HeuristicMatching.matchSubtrees(HeuristicMatching.java:131)
	at tdm.lib.HeuristicMatching.matchSubtrees(HeuristicMatching.java:131)
	at tdm.lib.HeuristicMatching.buildMatching(HeuristicMatching.java:74)
	at tdm.lib.TriMatching. (TriMatching.java:42)
	at tdm.lib.TriMatching. (TriMatching.java:31)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.merge.TDMMerger.mergeContent(TDMMerger.java:57)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.util.diffs.PageLayoutAwareMerger.mergeContent(PageLayoutAwareMerger.java:63)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.DefaultDraftManager.mergeContent(DefaultDraftManager.java:211)
{noformat}

h4. Workaround

*Warning:*
Workarounds involve deleting one or more drafts. Drafts contain edits that have not yet been saved, so important work can be lost by deleting them.

*5.5 and later*
If a user has been identified causing this problem, they can go to {{/users/viewmydrafts.action}} page and discard either all of their drafts or just the draft for the page that is known to trigger this problem.

*5.2 to 5.4*
Remove all drafts for the given user (Remember to replace {{<username>}} with the username of the user):
{code}
DELETE FROM BODYCONTENT WHERE contentid IN (SELECT contentid FROM CONTENT WHERE contenttype = 'DRAFT' AND creator in (SELECT user_key FROM user_mapping where username = '<username>'));
DELETE FROM CONTENT WHERE contenttype = 'DRAFT' AND creator in (SELECT user_key FROM user_mapping where username = '<username>');
{code}

*All versions*
Alternatively, all the drafts can be deleted directly from the DB:

# Back up Confluence DB as a precaution
# Run the following DELETE statements against the DB:
{code}
DELETE FROM BODYCONTENT WHERE contentid IN (SELECT contentid FROM CONTENT WHERE contenttype = 'DRAFT');
DELETE FROM CONTENT WHERE contenttype = 'DRAFT';
{code}
# Confluence Admin > Cache Statistics > Flush all (down at the bottom)
fields.summary: TDM Merger causes Confluence OOME due to infinite loop

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32163].
{panel}
A review of Confluence has been completed by experts at UC Berkley regarding accessibility to Confluence for the visually impaired. Please see the attached word document which summarizes the findings of said report. Included are the following recommendations but please see the document for more details.
 * Text editor: since text editor is inherently broken and unusable by a screen reader user, the text editor should be completely overhauled and/or replaced with an accessible alternative.
 * For dynamic content: ARIA (Accessible-Rich Internet Applications) alert to indicate to user that the content has been dynamically changed.
 * For semantic structure (headings): all pages should be reviewed to ensure that no heading levels have been skipped. Specifically, on search results page, search results should be h2 instead of h3.
 * All images should have appropriate alt tags.
 * Developer should use ARIA landmarks to help screen reader users identify main content and navigation regions on pages.
 * Alt text of images should be searchable as this is what the image will be called when a screen reader is used
fields.summary: Improve usability of Confluence for the visually impaired

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-32152].
  {panel}

Raised by a customer as a comment from the Page Properties Report Docs https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Page+Properties+Report+Macro?focusedCommentId=434209459#comment-434209459
{quote}
Hi, I am trying to have 3 page properties macros in different sections on 1 page. They all have the same label. I would like to collect all data in 1 page properties report. If I understand the documentation well, this should work (as long as the labels are the same). However, it seems that only the last one or the one in the righthand section is included in the report. I have tried without mentioning the column headers and with mentioning them. In the latter case, no values are displayed for the columns that do not belong to the last page properties macro. In the first case, only the columns belonging to the last or the right-hand macro are included. Please, advise.
{quote}

Current functionality is that when there are multiple Page Properties macros (with the same label specified) on a page the Page Properties Report macro only reports the data contained in ONE Page Properties macro in the report.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a page with a page properties macro. In that macro, add a table that looks like this:
|| a | 1 |
|| b | 2 |
2. In that macro, give it a label 'prop1'
3. Add another page property macro on that page, give it the same label 'prop1' with the contents:
|| c | 3 |
|| d | 4 |
4. Save the page. Now create a new page in the space.
In that new page, create a page properties report macro and give it the label 'prop1'.
Outcome: It reports on ONE table only  (c and d)
This feature request is so that it displays all data (a, b, c and d) because the label 'prop1' is specified on both. 

This appears to be the reverse of the use case in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-28776
fields.summary: It is not possible to have multiple page properties macros on the same page with the same label and report them on the same page properties report macro

Stop watching' link does not remove me as a watcher if I do not have permissions to that space anymore.

Our Confluence version 5.3.1.

A user watched a page or a space but now he doesn't have the permssions to access that page or space anymore.

If he goes now Profile > Watches, then he can still see the page / space as he is still watching it. If he then clicks "Stop Watching" then after the refresh the page or space is still listed with a link "Stop watching". No error message is provided and watching is just not removed.
fields.summary: Stop watching' link does not remove me as a watcher if I do not have permissions to that space anymore.

fields.description:
As a user, you can try to edit a blueprinnt and update the name of the blueprint.

It looks like you can save a 'Product Requirements' blueprints and rename it as 'Abc'. However when you save the page, you will see that the blueprint on the create page is still called 'Product Requirements'.

Steps to reproduce : 
* Navigate to Space Tools>Content tools
* Click edit against a blueprint
* Change the name of the page that opens and rename the page as Abc'. As a user it seems that we are renaming the blueprint.
* Change the content of the blueprint as well
* Save the blueprint
* Now try to create a page.
* Notice that the blueprint is still called 'Product Requirements' while you would expect to see 'Abc'
* Select 'Product Requirements' and notice that the changes made to the blueprint format show up in there

So as a user it is not clear that it is not possible to rename the title of a blueprint.

NOTE: This seems to be fixed in the newer release of Confluence as I tried to reproduce the issue in 5.4.1 and editing blueprint title is disabled in there :).

Regards,
Ruchi
fields.summary: Blueprint edit is not intuitive

Hi 
In our environment we still use allot of network paths Links: 
Expl Fodler: "N:\2_Kunden\22_Kunden\227_Prozesse 6 Arbeitsanweisungen"
Expl File: "N:\2_Kunden\22_Kunden\227_Prozesse 6 Arbeitsanweisungen\Prozess Vertrag.doc"

Where the N-Drive is a Network-Drive in our Company.
It would be nice to have a simple way to put such Links into the Confluence pages. And when clicking on it the Folder or the File on the Network-Drive gets opened directly.
In the moment I have to put: "file://N:/2_Kunden/22_Kunden/227_Prozesse 6 Arbeitsanweisungen" 
You loose time as you have to replace the \ with / and put file:// before 
A new setting in the Link Window would be nice to say: this is a network path and the software automaticaly converts the normal path to a url path.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a blank page
2. In editor, click {{Labels}} button to add labels
3. Input a label containing a comma ??{{,}}??, click {{Add}}
4. One new label will be added, ??{{,}}?? still be included
5. Close Label dialog, the Label button display "1 Label".
6. Click Save page, then the new page is shown with 2 labels separated.

-- Another scenario:
Start after step 5 above:
6. In the editor, click {{Label}} button again, add a new label including ??{{,}}??. The existing label will disappear, and whatever you input in text field will not be shown below text field.
7. Close Label dialog, the {{Label}} button display {{Labels}} as there is no label added before.
8. Save page, the new page is shown with all labels that you have input.
fields.summary: Page label can contain ',' when create a new page
